alert.note: Alert for Jewell (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 5:41AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Jewell, Nuckolls and Webster Counties through 615 AM CDT... At 541 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Ayr to near Blue Hill to near Red Cloud. Movement was southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Red Cloud around 545 AM CDT. Cowles and Rosemont around 550 AM CDT. Guide Rock around 555 AM CDT. Lawrence around 600 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Bostwick, Superior, Nelson and Nora. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
